name: Channel natural flow regime
functionStatement: Integrates the range of "typical" flows experienced by other processes. Examines the degree to which upstream infrastructure or land uses have fundamentally altered flow regimes (e.g., hydropeaking, dams, withdrawals).
descriptionMarkdown: Compares current daily-flow pattern to the natural regime, combining IHA metrics with the Richards-Baker flashiness index to screen for alteration from dams, withdrawals, or urbanization.
howToMeasureMarkdown: With flow data, compute IHA metrics and R-B and compare assessment vs reference periods; interpret departures in timing, magnitude, pulse frequency, and rise/fall rates along with low/zero-flow days. Without a gage, use qualitative indicators of flashiness, dryness, and flow-duration class from field evidence, imagery, and local observations.

levels.label: Strongly Disagree
levels.criteriaMarkdown:
Observation: Most IHA metrics outside reference; R-B much higher.
Criteria: Seasonal timing lost or shifted; extended low-flow or dry periods change expected flow duration class.

levels.label: Disagree
levels.criteriaMarkdown:
Observation: Several IHA components and R-B show clear departure.
Criteria: More frequent surges, shorter stable-flow periods, and noticeable increases in low or zero-flow days.

levels.label: Agree
levels.criteriaMarkdown:
Observation: One or two IHA groups show modest departure; R-B slightly higher.
Criteria: Small shifts in timing or pulse frequency; low-flow days increase only slightly.

levels.label: Strongly Agree
levels.criteriaMarkdown:
Observation: IHA metrics and R-B flashiness near reference; no increase in low/zero-flow days.
Criteria: Timing, magnitude, pulse frequency, and rise/fall rates within reference ranges; stable-flow windows intact.
